intro: Euphorbia remyi var. hanaleiensis, commonly known as the Hanalei euphorbia, is a succulent plant native to Hawaii. It is characterized by its fleshy, branching stems and small, inconspicuous flowers. The plant thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it suitable for arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are typically green and may have a waxy coating to reduce water loss. This variety is valued for its unique appearance and adaptability to tropical climates.
